wikipedia_page.main: George Ffolliott Powell-Shedden,  (1 April 1916 – 31 October 1994) was a Royal Air Force pilot who flew during the Battle of Britain and later went on to operational commands. He was also an Olympic bobsledder who competed for Britain in the late 1940s.

response: | No. 29 Squadron RAF || Mosquito || RAF Ford and RAF Drem || Led by Wing commander George Powell-Shedden. Converted from Beaufighters in May 1943.Wragg 2007, p. 1841. Transferred to the RAF Second Tactical Air Force on 1 May 1944.Bowman 2005, p. 50. || 10
* George Powell-Shedden (1916–1994), Royal Air Force pilot, United Kingdom
One of George Shedden's grandsons, George Powell-Shedden went on to become a decorated war-hero in the RAF and was also an Olympic bobsledder.
